H0.text: The metal spoon will feel hottest after 15 seconds when a metal, wooden, and plastic spoon are placed in hot water.

H1.text: The wooden spoon will feel hottest after 15 seconds when a metal spoon, a wooden spoon, and a plastic spoon are placed in hot water.

H2.text: The plastic spoon will feel hottest after 15 seconds in hot water, compared with the metal and wooden spoons.

H3.text: The three spoons will feel the same after being placed in hot water for 15 seconds, regardless of being a metal, wooden, or plastic spoon.

A4.text: metals typically have high thermal conductivity and are very efficient at conducting heat.

A5.text: metals typically have high thermal conductivity and are very efficient at conducting heat, while the opposite is true for insulating materials such as mineral wool or Styrofoam.
